00022 // PSE INTERCEPT LIBRARY SUPPORT ROUTINES
00024 
00025 //
00026 // Write a value to a net
00027 //
00028 void vmipseWriteNet(vmipseNetHandle handle, Uns32 value);
00029 
00030 //
00031 // Immediately trigger an event, restarting any threads waiting for it
00032 //
00033 Bool vmipseTriggerEvent(vmipseEventHandle handle);
00034 
00035 //
00036 // Access attributes of the named platform port, returning the domain associated
00037 // with the port (or NULL if no port of that name was found). Further attributes
00038 // of the port are returned in byref arguments:
00039 // lowAddr      : the low port address
00040 // highAddr     : the high port address
00041 // isMasterPort : whether the port is a master port
00042 // isDynamicPort: whether the (slave)port is re-mappable
00043 //
00044 memDomainP vmipsePlatformPortAttributes(
00045     vmiProcessorP pse,
00046     const char   *name,
00047     Addr         *lowAddr,
00048     Addr         *highAddr,
00049     Bool         *isMasterPort,
00050     Bool         *isDynamicPort
00051 );
00052 
00053 //
00054 // Map the simulated address range on the localDomain
00055 // to the domain connected to this port.
00056 //
00057 void vmipseAliasMemory(
00058     memDomainP localDomain,
00059     const char *portName,
00060     Addr       lowAddr,
00061     Addr       highAddr
00062 );
00063 
00064 #endif
